with regular and thoughtful maintenance; protection; and cleaning.#description##the vehicle is torreador red metallic over black cloth interior with the sync & sun package (microsoft sync with bluetooth; usb; aux; voice commands; etc.  power glass moonroof) and towing package (transmission oil cooler; trailer wiring; and hitch receiver). it has the 3.0 liter v6 engine with 240 hp and 223 ft-lbs. of torque connected to the 6-speed automatic ford 6f35 transmission and full-time awd.#maintenance##the following maintenance has been performed:#-oil and filter changes performed per the vehicles oil life monitor; oil and filter changed recently.#-automatic transmission fluid drain and fill at 50k miles and 69k miles with recommended mercon lv fluid#-rear diff fluid drain and fill at 50k miles#-spark plugs including new intake manifold gaskets at 60k miles#-new michelin premier ltx tires (not shown in photos; replaced a few days ago). the top of the line tire choice for this size and use!#-new ac compressor; blower motor resister; ac compressor resistor; and recharge. oem system failed due to ac compressor resistor failing leading to a high-pressure situation in the system. the entire system has been replaced with all oem parts by a reputable independent shop (renson automotive; campbell) and the underlying issue that caused the failure was addressed.#-brake fluid freshly flushed last week with bosch dot 5.1 fluid (back-compatible with dot 3 and 4 systems; but higher resistance to temperature and brake fade)#-cloth seats steam-cleaned and fabric-guarded once per year (most recently last week)#-clean smog in hand and ready to sell#minor mods##-tinted windows from previous owner; approximately 35% transmittance on rear seat windows and 20% transmittance on cargo area glass; front side windows and windshield appear stock. does a great job at keeping the heat out!#-ford motorcraft accessory mud splash guards#-full weathertech mat set including cargo mat; including windshield sunshade.#-installed two cargo holddowns in the trunk area (car came without any holddowns or attachment points stock)#niggles##-the car has an outstanding recall notice from ford (ford seems to take awhile to getting recall parts in to dealers) to fix something in the fuel delivery system; parts are not available yet; i will provide the recall notice letter to the buyer.#-someone turned left into the lower right rear door with their fender at low speeds. its an indiscrete scuff (look for it in the photos!) and i never got it fixed. i personally dont think its worse than the...#-quarter-sized door ding on the driver door under the handle. that was from a previous owner.#-gen 1 sync will crash on you occasionally; and i will want to show the buyer which fuse to pull and reset when its being particularly tempermental...that said; ive generally been impressed with its overall reliability vs its reputation; and its nice to have good bluetooth for hands-free phone and streaming audio; aux in; and a powered usb port and input for other devices...i use it to run a gen 7 ipod classic. i dont know if it does or does not work with other devices; but youre free to bring your device and cable along on a test drive and we can try it :)

MESSAGE: 2007 ford escape xlt 4wd with sliding/tilting sunroof; roof rack; good condition interior; with 195;000 miles.  i knew the original owner; who took exceptional care of the car; and i have done the same.  aside from cleaning it out; its good to go; never failed inspection; and still gets 20 mpg.  just put maintenance work into the engine and brakes (brake lines a year ago and new rotors & brake pads just a month ago).  vast majority of its miles are highway (without pushing it -- i drive at 70 mph max.)#the only drawbacks are its age/mileage and a little bit of rust around the edging of the rear wheel well (right only).  the ford dealer in acton gave it a good bill of health just a month ago.#great car for keeping it local; giving to a teenager to get around or head off to college; or just as insurance in bad weather.  ive really enjoyed my time driving through 6-12 of fallen/falling in this baby without fearing how it handled or how well it hugged the road. TITLE: ford escape 2006 for adventurers (updated)
ATTR: condition: excellent#drive: 4wd#fuel: gas#odometer: 86000#paint color: silver#size: mid-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: SUV
MESSAGE: update: to sweeten the deal; the car serviced the car; got new tags and emission inspection!#also; the fact this car is below 100k miles may help to get you a better deal with the bank##hi there#this is a car for adventurers. people who does not care for potholes or snow piles; or heavy rain. if you like to hit the road; maybe with your bike; or you have a dog or your kids; this may be the car for you. wheter going to the poconos in winter or to the shore in summer; this is how you will get there. low maintenance and ready to go.#gently used by the previous owner (worked in the ford dealership in town) and then by me for adventures for the last 20k miles; this car has been fantastic for me and for my dog. i traveled to the dakotas; wisconsin; illinois and ohio with this car. i am in general a good care-taker: fixed everything needs to be fixed and replaced parts that need to be replaced. this is also a good car for diy people like me (just replaced the rear bumper cover). tranny was completely replaced 10k miles ago. i just came from a 4th of july weekend trip to chicago and had zero problems (i like to drive). serpentine belt also recently serviced.#uses regular gas (i use mixtures with higher quality gas); so filling in is not expensive. spare parts are easy to find (and there are still a ton of this model car roaming the roads here and there). compare to others here in craiglist.#i moved recently to philly from montana with this car. my ford escape is fire-highway tested for 10000 miles by me and did not have any issues. i recently redid the transmission which is; admittedly; design issue for this car (google it). i have the bills to demonstrate that it is less than 8k miles old. how many other can say the same?#i am also adding a few extras for whomever offers the full price (or close to it): i put a pioneer stereo to plug my ipod and have my phone connected when duty calls (it has a free-hand bluetooth system). a sun shade in decent condition; and i am also adding a sherpak cargo bag for the roof that goes with the car (https://www.rei.com/product/677675/sherpak-go-15-roof-bag).#i have seen here in craiglist similar cars for less price or similar price. i do not think they compare to mine: higher mileage; dubious transmission status; not road tested; and certainly no extras.#in a few words; i do think this is a good deal for you provided that you are; in fact; someone who likes to drive; who does not care for snow or rain; that wants to haul equipment; and wants the freedom and the savings provided by it.#i just got the car registered in pa; so i am ready to show it after july 11th. i intend to sell before august. i can also take it to you for inspection if you are a serious buyer and not intending to hassle with the price. otherwise; i live close to center city so we could make an appointment for you to check it out.#let me know if you have any answers#thanks!#luis

TITLE: ford escape 2003 xlt
ATTR: VIN: 1FMYU931X3KB44854#condition: good#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: 4wd#fuel: gas#odometer: 171481#paint color: silver#size: mid-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: SUV
MESSAGE: the escape is running well. ive been the sole owner for the past 15 years; non smoker; no pets in the car; just had it detailed. i liked to take care of it -- always went to a recommended mechanic; generally followed all the mechanic recommendations to keep the car in good order.  the mechanics that ive been seeing for years; al and walt at cupertino auto care; say it is good to go - just keep an eye on the transmission fluid. i recently got all the recalls finished at the half moon bay ford dealership - their report was:#replace fix the front axel bars/shifter bars to eliminate a noise#that the ptu power transfer unit was leaking#a local mechanic in pacifica suggested:#i think similar repair for the noise (around $300)#replace a gasket around the transmission (also around $300)#going with the recommendation of al and walt; there is nothing to be done. for the transmission fluid - their experience with trying to replace that gasket is that it doesnt fix the issue and snowballs into major transmission work - simple enough just to keep an eye on the transmission fluid (which i really dont see leaking).#the noise is; neither quiet nor loud - it sounds like a metal on metal grinding noise when you turn the wheel. it has been there for at least 4 years. back then i replaced the struts on the recommendation of a mechanic - but it did not eliminate the noise. al and walt say it is not causing harm to the car; and not worth trying to fix.#other issues to note:#airbag light for passenger goes on - this is because of some little balloon thing that is hard to fix - i had it fixed once; then the light went back on -- the airbag is fine.#cd player doesnt work (but radio does)#the center console has a very small amount of wear#if you look under the car; you see a bit of metal bent down (see picture) but this has never impeded driving#one chip in the windshield#a minor dent on the body over the front wheel#small paint chips here and there#i cant think of anything else wrong with it; pluses#has a hitch#tires are pretty new#brakes are good#has had all regular service; like spark plugs at 100k#recent work - alternator; battery#otherwise good; strong original engine. this is a v6 - it will get you up the hills fast!#i have the title; the title is clean.#for coming by to see it - weekends are best. during the week is possible; but difficult between 12-3pm or 5:30pm-8pm.

MESSAGE: 2002 ford escape for sale. asking $2;100 or best offer.#4 wheel drive; sun roof; v6 engine; roof rack; automatic transmission; 235;000 miles#this suv has served me well for years; but its time for an upgrade. for an suv this old; the gas mileage is pretty decent (usually get 20 mpg on the highway).#the good:#-replaced transmission in july 2016.#-replaced all spark plugs in september 2016.#-replaced front brakes & changed oil/oil filter in july 2017.#-ive got as good as 25 mpg on the highway on some road trips.#-ac still works#the bad:#-has a few dents from the may hail storm - because most of the dents are small and the vehicle is white they are barely noticeable.#-the check engine light is on; but it seems to run well.#-there is a little groaning noise when turning the wheel sometimes - im guessing tie rods and/or ball joints probably need to be replaced within the next year.#-tires need to replaced soon.#-my dog was a frequent passenger; so despite best efforts there is still some dog hair in the interior.#-theres a dent in one roof rack bar.#-the paint is beginning to peel in some locations.#-a bolt on the back window broke off; the window stays on when latched; but the bold will have to be replaced to open just the window instead of the whole back hatch.#-a piece of fender is missing on the drivers side front after i was backing up to close to a retaining wall. i have the plastic cover; it just needs put back on.#this vehicle is by no means perfect; but for its price and what it is its not a bad deal for someone who needs something to get them around town and occasionally into the mountains with the understanding that it will need some extra maintenance from time to time (it is 15 years old; after all).#call or text for more details/questions/test drive/offers:#show contact info

TITLE: 2008 ford escape - rebuilt transmission
ATTR: condition: fair#cylinders: 4 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 177#paint color: grey#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: 2008 ford escape xlt.#grey; 177k miles; pw; pl; cd; cruise; power moonroof; satellite radio capable; bluetooth.#first; its a bit beat up & and rusty. bought it off a farm in wi in that condition. i travel for work; so its been a road car. very reliable. no exaggeration.#whats wrong with car:#crack in windshield. (one line; lower. doesnt impact sight line)#steering wheel airbag disengaged. (5mph straight on bumper collision before i bought). passenger and side curtain airbags are fine). drivers seatbelt needs replaced. horn works fine.#rust around wheel wells. (typical ford issue)#front left fender dented around wheelwell.#just had it in shop. needs front arm bushings and front inner tie rods; and intermediate steering shaft which causes a bit of play in steering wheel. also needs a resistor switch for fan blower.#have a quote from my local mechanic for $350 in labor for it all. i would highly recommend him. parts are approx $150 total from oreillys (bushings and tie rods; new control arms come with bushings) and $149 (intermediate shaft) from ford dealership directly. $10-$20 for resistor switch from any local auto parts store.#sensor lights (abs; airbag; brake; traction control- all due to airbag -triggers all those lights) on...and check engine light. dont know the code on that one. car runs great.#seats need shampood. i keep the car pretty clean but bought it that way.#whats right:#driven all over midwest for last 40k. very reliable.#completely rebuilt transmission (not a used one from junkyard) last october from a 40 yr transmission mechanic in east peoria. he pulled it out and rebuilt. $1700 total. i can provide shop info and number.#good gas mileage. 60mph: 30-31 mpg. 70mph: 26-27mpg. 80mph: 24mpg. i check the mileage at every fill up. i dont run the tank empty. mileage has been consistently the same since ive owned.#newer tires#front brakes and rotors last september. wheel bearing; hub; and alignment sleeve 1 month ago; and bit of exhaust work.#does not smoke or knock/ping. quiet car.#air; heat and defrost work as they should.#no leaks of any kind. i park on concrete and regularly check.#car runs great. ive trusted it with my work for a year now.#title in hand. $2600 or b.o. i will pay for parts needed if you pay me close to full price. good reliable vehicle that should run another 100k. i have an 11 escape that i am going to be using primarily; so i am selling this one.#wanted to be specific about all issues so you know what youre getting with no question marks. lets talk and strike a deal.#check reply button for my contact info.
